ellipsoide

Class Zone

  • java.lang.Object
    • ellipsoide.Zone

  • public class Zone
extends java.lang.Object
    class which is counting the number of vectors in the right field of the ellipse. An ellipse is built of different zones. each one must be colored agreeing with the number of vectors it contains
    Author:
    GERVAIS florent

    • Constructor Detail

      • Zone

        public Zone(double lat_angle_low,
    double lat_angle_high,
    double long_angle_begin,
    double long_angle_end,
    int nbPointsMax)
        this constructor create the zone
        Parameters:
        lat_angle_high - maximum latitude delimiting the zone
        lat_angle_low - minimum latitude delimiting the zone
        long_angle_begin - minimum longitude delimiting the zone
        long_angle_end - maximum longitude delimiting the zone
        nbPointsMax - number of points on the surface of the sphere to get the right calibration

        public boolean updateZoneCourante(VecteurFiltrable<java.lang.Double> v,
                         VecteurFiltrable<java.lang.Double> center)
        Thanks to that method we can find the currant zone in order to print the current zone
        Parameters:
        v - the currant vector that is actually the last one received by the IMU
        center - center of the sphere
        Returns:
        boolean true when the vector is in this zone
